front.title: Customer MAC Address Flushing Mechanisms for Provider Backbone Bridging over VPLS

abstract.t: The scalability of H-VPLS (either with MPLS or Ethernet access network) can be improved by incorporating Provider Backbone Bridge (PBB) functionality in VPLS access. PBB introduces the notion of Backbone MAC (B-MAC) addresses vs. Customer MAC (C-MAC) addresses, thereby leading to the requirement for having MAC address flushing mechanisms for each. This document discusses a C-MAC address flushing notification mechanism to be used in VPLS networks that employ PBB technology.
